Key Match Events: Doc Rivers, the coach of the Milwaukee Bucks, was fined by the NBA for publicly criticizing officiating that led to the deciding points in a 115-114 loss to the Charlotte Hornets.
Giannis Antetokounmpo was involved in a controversial foul call with 7.3 seconds left, which Rivers argued was incorrect.
LaMelo Ball made two free throws to give Charlotte the lead for good.
Antetokounmpo's jumper at the buzzer rimmed out, and the Hornets escaped with the win.
LaMelo Ball was fined $100,000 for using an anti-gay slur in his postgame remarks.
Post-Match Reflections: Doc Rivers expressed frustration over the officiating, stating it was the second consecutive game with an incorrect call on the final play.
Rivers noted the Bucks were fortunate in a previous game against Detroit when a similar situation occurred, but the opposing player missed the free throws.
